guide.introduction_rendered:
Relevant parts
  • wool roving
  • Sternlab LED Sewing Kit
Tools
  • Foam sheet
  • Sewing needle
  • felting needles

lines.text: Gather tools and materials.
lines.text_raw: Gather tools and materials.

lines.text: Grip the wool roving with your hands a good distance apart, and pull gently.
lines.text_raw: Grip the wool roving with your hands a good distance apart, and pull gently.

lines.text: Twist up the fibers. The more criss-crossed they are, the easier it is to felt.
lines.text_raw: Twist up the fibers. The more criss-crossed they are, the easier it is to felt.

lines.text: Fold it together into a disc-like shape and begin to poke it with felting needles.
lines.text_raw: Fold it together into a disc-like shape and begin to poke it with felting needles.

lines.text: Safety! Felting needles are the sharpest sharp thing you've ever played with, unless you're a surgeon.
lines.text_raw: Safety! Felting needles are the sharpest sharp thing you've ever played with, unless you're a surgeon.

lines.text: Always watch your hands while felting.
lines.text_raw: Always watch your hands while felting.

lines.text: Never felt when you're tired.
lines.text_raw: Never felt when you're tired.

lines.text: Use shallow, soft pokes instead of heavy pokes.
lines.text_raw: Use shallow, soft pokes instead of heavy pokes.

lines.text: When you do stab yourself, just put a bandage on it and keep felting!
lines.text_raw: When you do stab yourself, just put a bandage on it and keep felting!

lines.text: Once it starts to form a shape and is a little bit combined, pull the disc off the foam and turn it over.
lines.text_raw: Once it starts to form a shape and is a little bit combined, pull the disc off the foam and turn it over.

lines.text: Continue poking.
lines.text_raw: Continue poking.

lines.text: After a while, there won't be any more loose fiber to poke.
lines.text_raw: After a while, there won't be any more loose fiber to poke.

lines.text: Loosely twist up another wisp of wool roving and wrap it around your disc.
lines.text_raw: Loosely twist up another wisp of wool roving and wrap it around your disc.

lines.text: Lay it down on the foam and keep poking until all of the new fiber is incorporated into the disc.
lines.text_raw: Lay it down on the foam and keep poking until all of the new fiber is incorporated into the disc.

lines.text: Twist, wrap, and poke many more layers of roving.
lines.text_raw: Twist, wrap, and poke many more layers of roving.

lines.text: When it's nice and thick in the middle, but the edges are still fuzzy, use tiny pokes along the edge of the disc.
lines.text_raw: When it's nice and thick in the middle, but the edges are still fuzzy, use tiny pokes along the edge of the disc.

lines.text: Create one large backing disc and one smaller accent disc and check that the sizing is how you like it.
lines.text_raw: Create one large backing disc and one smaller accent disc and check that the sizing is how you like it.

lines.text: Felt shrinks as you work, so allow for things to get a bit smaller during finishing.
lines.text_raw: Felt shrinks as you work, so allow for things to get a bit smaller during finishing.

lines.text: Twist up a small wisp of fiber for the accent design.
lines.text_raw: Twist up a small wisp of fiber for the accent design.

lines.text: Lay it on the surface, overlapping the edges.
lines.text_raw: Lay it on the surface, overlapping the edges.

lines.text: Poke in a straight line across the disc.
lines.text_raw: Poke in a straight line across the disc.

lines.text: Pull the long tails toward the center and tack them down.
lines.text_raw: Pull the long tails toward the center and tack them down.

lines.text: Now do the details for the top disc using tiny wisps of fiber.
lines.text_raw: Now do the details for the top disc using tiny wisps of fiber.

lines.text: If you want your pinball bumper to light up, cut a hole in the back disc with very sharp scissors, then widen the hole with needlenose pliers.
lines.text_raw: If you want your pinball bumper to light up, cut a hole in the back disc with very sharp scissors, then widen the hole with needlenose pliers.

lines.text: Affix the LED with wire or conductive thread to the battery holder. See the soft circuit sample project.
lines.text_raw: Affix the LED with wire or conductive thread to the battery holder. See the [guide|44|soft circuit sample project].

lines.text: Felt around the LED and affix the top disc.
lines.text_raw: Felt around the LED and affix the top disc.

lines.text: Affix the finished pendant to a necklace.
lines.text_raw: Affix the finished pendant to a necklace.

guide.title: Needle Felted Pinball Bumper Necklace
